intro: Medinilla camiguinensis, commonly known as the Camiguin medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy bracteate inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
